titleStmt.title: Best and Worst Part of the Sheep Harran
SHAWI Corpus
titleStmt.funder: Funded by the FWF Austrian Science Fund under the number P 33574

publicationStmt.distributor: Austrian Center for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

monogr.title: A Digital Dictionary of Shawi Arabic

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the dict prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a entry in the SHAWI glossary.

spanGrp.span: Once upon a time, my teacher, there was a sheikh of the Arabs, a sheikh of the Arabs, a big sheikh who was the host of a gathering place and a guesthouse. He said to one of his men who worked with him, to his servant.
He said to him, “Go and bring me a ewe today! Slaughter it and bring me a piece from the best part. Bring me the best part so that I will eat it.”
This one went away and brought him a ewe. He slaughtered it, cut it and opened it. Then he cut its tongue and brought it to the sheikh. He grilled it and brought it to the sheikh.
When he brought it to the sheikh, the sheikh recognized that this was the tongue and said, “O So-and-so!
Is the tongue all what you have found? Man, what about the leg, the liver, the let’s say the spleen. You haven’t brought the good things.

What you brought me, is this tongue! Tsk!” (The man) remained silent and said nothing. So, he said to him, “Go again and slaughter a ewe for me! And bring me the worst part. Grill the worst part and give it to me!”
This one went away again, slaughtered a ewe for him and again cut the tongue. He cut it, roasted it and brought it to him.
Tsk! When he brought it he recognized that it was again the tongue and said, “My brother, son of my uncle, dude, man! When I tell you to bring me from the best part, you bring me the tongue.
(And when I say) bring me the worst part, you bring me again the tongue. What’s the point of this? What’s the point of this story?”
He said, “O my sheikh! When the tongue of a human utters something good, there is nothing better than it. But when it utters something bad, there is nothing worse than it.
You said (bring the) good – it is the tongue and you said (bring the) bad – it is the tongue.” He said, “My brother, you are right. Okay, I accept it!” Enjoy it! So, he was not angry with him.
